intro: Ecbolium viride, commonly known as green ecbolium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Scrophulariaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady garden environments. Ecbolium viride is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its delicate foliage and unique floral display.
